property.name: Scheme
property.description: The scheme for connecting to Splunk.

property.name: Hostname
property.description: The ip address or hostname of the Splunk server.

property.name: Port
property.description: The port of the Splunk server.

property.name: Connection Timeout
property.description: Max wait time for connection to the Splunk server.

property.name: Read Timeout
property.description: Max wait time for response from the Splunk server.

property.name: Query
property.description: The query to execute. Typically beginning with a <search> command followed by a search clause, such as <search source="tcp:7689"> to search for messages received on TCP port 7689.

property.name: Time Field Strategy
property.description: Indicates whether to search by the time attached to the event, or by the time the event was indexed in Splunk.

allowableValue.description: Search based on the time of the event which may be different than when the event was indexed.
Search based on the time the event was indexed in Splunk.

property.name: Time Range Strategy
property.description: Indicates how to apply time ranges to each execution of the query. Selecting a managed option allows the processor to apply a time range from the last execution time to the current execution time. When using <Managed from Beginning>, an earliest time will not be applied on the first execution, and thus all records searched. When using <Managed from Current> the earliest time of the first execution will be the initial execution time. When using <Provided>, the time range will come from the Earliest Time and Latest Time properties, or no time range will be applied if these properties are left blank.

allowableValue.description: The processor will manage the date ranges of the query starting from the beginning of time.
The processor will manage the date ranges of the query starting from the current time.
The the time range provided through the Earliest Time and Latest Time properties will be used.

property.name: Earliest Time
property.description: The value to use for the earliest time when querying. Only used with a Time Range Strategy of Provided. See Splunk's documentation on Search Time Modifiers for guidance in populating this field.

property.name: Latest Time
property.description: The value to use for the latest time when querying. Only used with a Time Range Strategy of Provided. See Splunk's documentation on Search Time Modifiers for guidance in populating this field.

property.name: Time Zone
property.description: The Time Zone to use for formatting dates when performing a search. Only used with Managed time strategies.

property.name: Application
property.description: The Splunk Application to query.

property.name: Owner
property.description: The owner to pass to Splunk.

property.name: Token
property.description: The token to pass to Splunk.

property.name: Username
property.description: The username to authenticate to Splunk.

property.name: Password
property.description: The password to authenticate to Splunk.

property.name: Security Protocol
property.description: The security protocol to use for communicating with Splunk.

property.name: Output Mode
property.description: The output mode for the results.

property.name: SSL Context Service
property.description: The SSL Context Service used to provide client certificate information for TLS/SSL connections.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: Results retrieved from Splunk are sent out this relationship.

writesAttribute.name: splunk.query
writesAttribute.description: The query that performed to produce the FlowFile.

writesAttribute.name: splunk.earliest.time
writesAttribute.description: The value of the earliest time that was used when performing the query.

writesAttribute.name: splunk.latest.time
writesAttribute.description: The value of the latest time that was used when performing the query.

stateful.description: If using one of the managed Time Range Strategies, this processor will store the values of the latest and earliest times from the previous execution so that the next execution of the can pick up where the last execution left off. The state will be cleared and start over if the query is changed.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.splunk.PutSplunk
extension.description: Sends logs to Splunk Enterprise over TCP, TCP + TLS/SSL, or UDP. If a Message Delimiter is provided, then this processor will read messages from the incoming FlowFile based on the delimiter, and send each message to Splunk. If a Message Delimiter is not provided then the content of the FlowFile will be sent directly to Splunk as if it were a single message.

property.name: Hostname
property.description: Destination hostname or IP address

property.name: Port
property.description: Destination port number

property.name: Max Size of Socket Send Buffer
property.displayName: Max Size of Socket Send Buffer
property.description: The maximum size of the socket send buffer that should be used. This is a suggestion to the Operating System to indicate how big the socket buffer should be. If this value is set too low, the buffer may fill up before the data can be read, and incoming data will be dropped.

property.name: Idle Connection Expiration
property.description: The amount of time a connection should be held open without being used before closing the connection. A value of 0 seconds will disable this feature.

property.name: Timeout
property.description: The timeout for connecting to and communicating with the destination. Does not apply to UDP

property.name: Timeout
property.description: The timeout for connecting to and communicating with the destination. Does not apply to UDP

property.name: Character Set
property.description: Specifies the character set of the data being sent.

property.name: Protocol
property.description: The protocol for communication.

property.name: Message Delimiter
property.description: Specifies the delimiter to use for splitting apart multiple messages within a single FlowFile. If not specified, the entire content of the FlowFile will be used as a single message. If specified, the contents of the FlowFile will be split on this delimiter and each section sent as a separate message. Note that if messages are delimited and some messages for a given FlowFile are transferred successfully while others are not, the messages will be split into individual FlowFiles, such that those messages that were successfully sent are routed to the 'success' relationship while other messages are sent to the 'failure' relationship.

property.name: SSL Context Service
property.description: Specifies the SSL Context Service to enable TLS socket communication

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: FlowFiles that failed to send to the destination are sent out this relationship.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: FlowFiles that are sent successfully to the destination are sent out this relationship.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.splunk.PutSplunkHTTP
extension.description: Sends flow file content to the specified Splunk server over HTTP or HTTPS. Supports HEC Index Acknowledgement.

property.name: Scheme
property.description: The scheme for connecting to Splunk.

property.name: Hostname
property.description: The ip address or hostname of the Splunk server.

property.name: Port
property.description: The HTTP Event Collector HTTP Port Number.

property.name: Security Protocol
property.description: The security protocol to use for communicating with Splunk.

property.name: Owner
property.description: The owner to pass to Splunk.

property.name: Token
property.description: HTTP Event Collector token starting with the string Splunk. For example 'Splunk 1234578-abcd-1234-abcd-1234abcd'

property.name: Username
property.description: The username to authenticate to Splunk.

property.name: Password
property.description: The password to authenticate to Splunk.

property.name: request-channel
property.description: Identifier of the used request channel.

property.name: source
property.description: User-defined event source. Sets a default for all events when unspecified.

property.name: source-type
property.description: User-defined event sourcetype. Sets a default for all events when unspecified.

property.name: host
property.description: Specify with the host query string parameter. Sets a default for all events when unspecified.

property.name: index
property.description: Index name. Specify with the index query string parameter. Sets a default for all events when unspecified.

property.name: content-type
property.description: The media type of the event sent to Splunk. If not set, "mime.type" flow file attribute will be used. In case of neither of them is specified, this information will not be sent to the server.

property.name: character-set
property.description: The name of the character set.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: FlowFiles that failed to send to the destination are sent to this relationship.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: FlowFiles that are sent successfully to the destination are sent to this relationship.

readsAttribute.name: mime.type
readsAttribute.description: Uses as value for HTTP Content-Type header if set.

writesAttribute.name: splunk.acknowledgement.id
writesAttribute.description: The indexing acknowledgement id provided by Splunk.

writesAttribute.name: splunk.responded.at
writesAttribute.description: The time of the response of put request for Splunk.

systemResourceConsideration.description: An instance of this component can cause high usage of this system resource. Multiple instances or high concurrency settings may result a degradation of performance.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.splunk.QuerySplunkIndexingStatus
extension.description: Queries Splunk server in order to acquire the status of indexing acknowledgement.

property.name: Scheme
property.description: The scheme for connecting to Splunk.

property.name: Hostname
property.description: The ip address or hostname of the Splunk server.

property.name: Port
property.description: The HTTP Event Collector HTTP Port Number.

property.name: Security Protocol
property.description: The security protocol to use for communicating with Splunk.

property.name: Owner
property.description: The owner to pass to Splunk.

property.name: Token
property.description: HTTP Event Collector token starting with the string Splunk. For example 'Splunk 1234578-abcd-1234-abcd-1234abcd'

property.name: Username
property.description: The username to authenticate to Splunk.

property.name: Password
property.description: The password to authenticate to Splunk.

property.name: request-channel
property.description: Identifier of the used request channel.

property.name: ttl
property.description: The maximum time the processor tries to acquire acknowledgement confirmation for an index, from the point of registration. After the given amount of time, the processor considers the index as not acknowledged and transfers the FlowFile to the "unacknowledged" relationship.

property.name: max-query-size
property.description: The maximum number of acknowledgement identifiers the outgoing query contains in one batch. It is recommended not to set it too low in order to reduce network communication.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: A FlowFile is transferred to this relationship when the acknowledgement was not successful due to errors during the communication. FlowFiles are timing out or unknown by the Splunk server will transferred to "undetermined" relationship.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: A FlowFile is transferred to this relationship when the acknowledgement was successful.

relationship.name: unacknowledged
relationship.description: A FlowFile is transferred to this relationship when the acknowledgement was not successful. This can happen when the acknowledgement did not happened within the time period set for Maximum Waiting Time. FlowFiles with acknowledgement id unknown for the Splunk server will be transferred to this relationship after the Maximum Waiting Time is reached.

relationship.name: undetermined
relationship.description: A FlowFile is transferred to this relationship when the acknowledgement state is not determined. FlowFiles transferred to this relationship might be penalized. This happens when Splunk returns with HTTP 200 but with false response for the acknowledgement id in the flow file attribute.

readsAttribute.name: splunk.acknowledgement.id
readsAttribute.description: The indexing acknowledgement id provided by Splunk.

readsAttribute.name: splunk.responded.at
readsAttribute.description: The time of the response of put request for Splunk.
